description: The Flash loses his heart... and possibly more as the Speed Force's secret is revealed!
name: Lightning in a Bottle, Part 4: Fast in the Life Lane

volume.name: The Flash: The Fastest Man Alive

description: Here it is, True Believers! You knew we'd do it sooner or later! From the Venerable Vaults of Marveldom, it's the Mighty Marvel Handbook -- 1960s style! Just what is the 1960s Handbook, you ask? Imagine a Handbook written at 11:59 p.m. Dec. 31, 1969. The profiles within cover everything published by the hallowed House of Ideas up until that point. So if it's from a comic that has a December 1969 cover date or earlier, you'll find it in this magnificent mag! From the Acrobat to Zota -- with the Avengers, Captain America, Captain Marvel, Daredevil, Dr. Strange, the Fantastic Four, the Hulk, the Silver Surfer, Spider-Man, the Sub-Mariner, Thor and the X-Men as they were in the 1960s, as well as â€™60s-era characters such as Factor Three, the Beasts of Berlin, Chili, the Infant Terrible, Mogul of the Mystic Mountain, the Painter of 1000 Perils, the Living Brain, Patsy Walker, the Blackie Drago Vulture, the Ringo Kid and more!
name: Marvel Legacy: The 1960s Handbook

concept_credits.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

first_appearance_concepts.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

description: Jessica remains the captive of J. Harker, leader of the 68 reincarnated men responsible for the birth of the Snake Woman. Their individual destinies require that they destroy each other, so how will Jessica react when Harker offers her an alternative, an alternative that will turn Jessica Peterson into a cold blooded killer!

Jessica has learned that she is the latest incarnation of the lethal Snake Woman. But what is her relationship to Harker and the rest of the 68? The Snake Woman's past is unearthed as Jessica's murderous destiny becomes clear! Â Â

name: You'll Never See What's Coming Next!

description:
Overview

Ravage is framed for the enviornmental crimes of his company. He escapes an assassination attempt and decides to use older, better-built technology in the fight against his new enemies. His secretary Tiana and a new sidekick Dack become sucked into his adventures.
name: Ravage 2099

description:
Overview

Jake Gallows AKA Punisher 2099 seeks vengeance for the death of his family, targeting Kron Stone and his gang of murderers. Kron wears a device stopping all fast-moving projecticles; he is bulletproof. So Jake Gallows slowly stabs him.

Other forces gather to target the new vigilante in town.
name: The Mourning After

description: Punisher stops the dealer who was selling illegal virtual reality discs and takes him to the Punishment Hotel where decides to imprison him for 20 years. Later at work Punisher finds out that the girl who was buying virtual reality discs jumped off the bridge and died while being under their influence. The Punisher heads back to the Punishment Hotel and changes the sentince from 20 years to execution. The dealer is executed by the molecular disintegrator.
name: Last Exit From The Bronx

description: The Punisher tries to help a neighborhood beseiged by violent forces. The local vigilante perishes in the defeat of the evil men. The Punisher mourns until the mask is picked up by another and the hero 'lives' on.
name: Heroes Day

description: The Punisher's mini-jail experiences a break-out!
name: Punishment Hotel

description: The fight between Punisher and Multi-Fractor rages on. Punisher is able to overpower Multi-Fractor but that soon changed when the group of the corrupt cops helped Multi-Fractor. With the help of his friend Matt Axel Punisher is able to defeat Multi-Fractor but he refuses to cross the line and kill the corrupt cops. Matt takes over the controll over Punisher's suit and shoots the cops. Punisher blames Frearmaster for making him cross that line. Meanwhile Fearmaster hires the team of Ninja Nostras to bring Punisher down.
name: Techno Gladiators

description: Love And Bullets Pt. 1
name: Love and Bullets Part One: Confession

description: Love And Bullets Pt. 2
name: Love and Bullets Part Two: Passion

description:
Overview

The Fearmaster kills to Kerry Dowenn, this fact marks also the beginning on the furious rampage of the Punisher and his open-conflict with the Cyber Nostra.
name: Love and Bullets Part three: Requiem

description:
THE FALL OF THE HAMMER PART 5

One for all? Will Jake Gallows, Punisher 2099, play nice with his new teammates? The Fall of the Hammer event continues as Punisher, along with 2099â€™s X-Men, Spider-Man, and Doom, save Asgard from Alechemax!

Corporations are set to take advantage of the public's worship of Norse gods and heroes with a floating city. However, the gods have seemingly gone mad and many believe the city is set to fall.
name: The Fall of The Hammer, Part 5: All For One

description: Public Enemy File Pt. 1
name: Red Dog Day

description: Public Enemy File Pt. 2
name: Silence Of The Sheep

description: Public Enemy File Pt. 3
name: Shopping Maul

description:
We were given a hint of the new Green Goblin when he appeared in Spectacular Spider-Man #225, June 1995 cover date. In October 1995, Green Goblin #1 was released. My first thought was - 'Oh no, yet another spinoff series cashing on Spider-Mania.'

Plot

Philip Urich is working as an intern at the Daily Bugle. His uncle, Ben Urich, is an investigative reporter there. Uncle Ben is working on a new book - "Dynasty of Evil", the story of the Osborn Family and the Green Goblin. While investigating an old Osborn warehouse, Philip stumbles onto a Green Goblin lair, falls into some green goop, and then has to don the costume to rescue his uncle.

Seems the combination of the green goop and the electric circuitry in the Goblin's mask turns the dead-end Generation X-er into the manaical butt-kicking super-powered Green dude on the Bat Glider. Philip is a nice enough guy who got stuck in his older brother's shadow, fell in with some bad friends, and is misunderstood by his parents. Single and shy by day but a hero-by-night. He comes across as a cross between a young Peter Parker, and Jim Carrey in "The Mask".

Actually the parallels with both Peter and The Mask are rife, but comic books have never been ashamed to steal stuff from other popular culture - and popular culture has returned the crime on many an occasion. Since neither seem to want to call the Culture Police, then let's just ignore a little plagarism, and get on with the action!
name: Enter the Green Goblin

description: He smokes, he drinks, he swears! He lies to women, and they love it! He's Lance Blastoff, and he says, "Get it while you can get it, then get going while the going's good!" Lance Blastoff: Role model for the next millennium! Plus "Daddy's Little Girl," the Sin City story from Decade of Dark Horse!
name: Lance Blastoff

description:
Rahul has followed Iyam to a meeting at the docks with Amara Gaelle. She tells Iyam of Lord Bala's contracting of Kratha to kill Tara before she becomes the Devi. Angered by this and by Amara's statement that possibly Iyam was becoming too attached to Tara to kill her, he begin begins to attack her, but is interrupted when his guards return having found Rahul. Iyam leaves Rahul for Amara to deal with and leaves to go kill Tara himself.

Elsewhere on the the a rooftop overlooking the Durapasya that have kidnapped Tara. Kratha is confronted by a man asking why she has forsaken her duty as an Aspara for that of an assassin for hire and is now working to kill that which she is to protect. A battle ensues and Kratha lands a blow as the man teleports away.

In soma-induced trance Tara meets here otherselves: versions of herself from the past, future, and from what might have been. After being told goodbye and good luck. Isana, the first Devi, appears and explains what is happening and why, and that despite Tara's protests she must proceed and takes her to be blessed by the Gods.

Iyam the erupts from Tara's cell phone amidst the crowd of Durapasya and states that he will kill them all.
name: Namaha

description:
Overview

With Buffy incapacitated, Amy the witch has taken the opportunity to-get this-lay siege with an army of the undead. Willow takes her on in a witches' battle royal as hundreds of Slayers defend their Scottish citadel, but without the kiss of true love, Buffy will be out of commission indefinitely-with an unwelcome familiar face, and an image you won't soon forget.

Buffy creator Joss Whedon brings Buffy back to Dark Horse in this direct follow-up to Season Seven of the smash-hit TV series.

Buffy is locked in her own dreams. As she slumbers, she hears someone say, "My love." In mild disgust, she realises it's Ethan Rayne, ex-associate of her mentor Giles. Ethan has come to tell her that she's not just stuck in her dreams, she's been locked in her dreamspace, the place where she is constantly dreaming, even when she's awake. He tells her that he managed to get in by hitching a ride when Amy put a spell on Buffy. He says that all dreaming spells require a small piece of the person casting it to be used. With his help, Buffy breaks through to Amy's own dreamspace where she sees Willow battling the evil witch.

On the outside, Willow is fighting Amy and letting her appear to win. When Amy questions how she got so weak, Willow simply tells her that she's decoding her mojo. Then she blasts Amy to the ground. Just as Amy springs back and throws a bolt at Willow, Dawn appears and smooshes Amy to the ground with her giant foot.

Meanwhile, back in Amy's dreamspace, Buffy discovers the ratcage then a massive cage made of three Xs. Ethan gives her a mysterious message that she must remember everything she sees because twilight is falling and she'll need all te help she can get.

Once Amy is restrained, Willow, Xander and the rest of the slayers congregate in Buffy's room. Willow tells them that only true love's kiss can wake her. She tells them all to close their eyes and whoever loves Buffy is to step forward and kiss her. As it's done, Buffy jolts awake to the cry "Cinnamon buns!"

The search begins for the symbolism that Buffy describes, plus the strange symbol from issue 1. Giles speaks to the demons that were lured to be killed by Buffy and her slayers. Giles tries to convince them that the slayers didn't trick them, that it was something deeper and to give him all the information they can.

As Willow tries to read Amy's mind and sees some kind of military installment, she's sucked into a portal and captured. Buffy tries to follow her but she just misses it. As Willow wakes up, she finds herself restrained to a table with a man she thought was dead standing over her.... With relish, Warren tells her that she really got under his skin!
name: The Long Way Home, Part III

volume.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer Season Eight

description: A Marvel/Malibu event! A new threat is rising in the Ultraverse...a force so powerful, it will take mutant X-Men and ultraheroes alike to prevent this threat from destroying our universe. The Phoenix rises once again--whether it will be good or evil can only be determined by who is chosen to become the next Phoenix!
name: Book 2: Genesis

description: A Marvel/Malibu event! The battle to save the cosmic balance between the Marvel and Malibu universes concludes in this senses-shattering special event book, featuring Marvel's X-Men and Malibu's most popular ultras! What price must the Ultraverse pay to ensure the survival of the universe...and who will be standing, and created, when the smoke clears?
name: Book 1: Revelations

description: Introducing Foxfire! The price of survival from the deadly force of Phoenix is high! This is the aftermath of the cosmic crossover of the X-Men and the Ultraverse! It also lays the foundation for the Ultraverse's major launch of 1996...Foxfire!
name: Book 3: Aftermath

description:
Are the rumors of Uncle Ben's return from the grave true? How many people has J. Jonah Jameson hired and fired? Who is that armored Spider-Man from the future with six arms? You know the Lizard - but who's the Iguana? Can you name all the alien symbiotes besides Venom and Carnage? Spidey's ex-girlfriend Deb Whitman is back! What's her story, anyway? All these questions and more will be answered in the SPIDER-MAN: BACK IN BLACK HANDBOOK, spotlighting everyone's favorite wall-crawler sporting his enigmatic ebony attire, with an in-depth look at Spider-Man's fantastic powers. This issue also features the return of fan-favorite classic Handbook illustrator Eliot R. Brown with tech-specs on Tony Stark's Spider-Man costume.

New entries and updates on Spider-Man, his friends and foes, and anyone in-between.
name: Spider-Man: Back In Black Handbook

concept_credits.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

first_appearance_concepts.name: Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe

description:
On the docks Amara takes a call from Bala and tells him that Iyam has 'somehow' learned of Bala's contract with Kratha to kill Tara. She then turns gun pointed to Rahul and promptly shoots the two guards holding him. She then tells Rahul to go to a temple and save the girl that is to be killed. Eventually he agrees.

Elsewhere, Iyam is in the midst of battle with the Durapasya as Kratha descends upon Tara for the kill as the man that confronted Kratha earlier, Agantuk, teleports her into a nearby car telling the Durapasya drivers save her. Kratha and Iyam then form a battlefield alliance and begin to follow in a truck.

In her some-induced trance Isana tells the story of Devi: what she is, why she was created, and explains of Bala and other accomplishments of the Devi.

Agantuk returns to the Durapasya temple and explains what has happened. His tale is thwarted however by Swamiji, the head of the Durapasya. Swamiji does not believe him, nor does he put any value on Tara, for should she be compromised he is sure the gods would give them another. Swamiji also disputes Amaguk's claim that they should not sacrifice Tara, but should allow the Devi to infuse with Tara so that the human and divine may coexist.
name: Prarambh

description:
Number 30 in the B.P.R.D. series.

Abe Sapien's investigation brings him closer to a jungle compound housing a group of cyborgs with a strange connection to his own past.

Meanwhile, in the new B.P.R.D. headquarters basement, Johann makes a startling discovery about a member of the team, and Liz has a vision of the end of the world.

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description:
Number 25 in the B.P.R.D. series.

Captain Daimio tells the B.P.R.D. the story of his own death in the jungles of Bolivia. Meanwhile, Dr. Kate Corrigan, searching rural France for a clandestine text with the secret to bringing Roger back to life, finds herself a guest in a strange shop on the site of a castle that was destroyed over half a century ago.

Captain Daimio tells the B.P.R.D. the story of his own death in the jungles of Bolivia.

Meanwhile, Dr. Kate Corrigan, searching rural France for a clandestine text with the secret to bringing Roger back to life, finds herself a guest in a strange shop on the site of a castle that was destroyed over half a century ago.

The seller, Thierry, appears to be the long dead Marquis Adoet de Fabre, the owner of the castle, a fierce collector and negociator, mysteriously not aging since the destruction of his castle.

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description:
Number 26 in the B.P.R.D. series.

While searching for an arcane text that could hold the secret to bringing Roger back to life, Dr. Kate Corrigan is trapped in a mysterious French village where a collector of occult objects has terrible plans for one of the B.P.R.D.'s most valuable assets. Meanwhile, back at B.P.R.D. headquarters, Johann Kraus reveals secrets from his past life as a medium, and a bizarre turn taken during one of his sÃ©ances.

While searching for an arcane text that could hold the secret to bringing Roger back to life, Dr. Kate Corrigan is trapped in a mysterious French village where a collector of occult objects has terrible plans for one of the B.P.R.D.'s most valuable assets.

Meanwhile, back at B.P.R.D. headquarters, Johann Kraus reveals secrets from his past life as a medium, and a bizarre turn taken during one of his sÃ©ances.

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description: From the Venerable Vaults of Marveldom, itâ€™s the Mighty Marvel Handbook -- 1970s style! Just what is the 1970s Handbook, you ask? Imagine a Handbook written at 11:59 p.m. Dec. 31, 1979. The profiles within cover everything published by the hallowed House of Ideas up until that point. So if itâ€™s from a comic that has a December 1979 cover date or earlier, youâ€™ll find it in this magnificent mag! Featuring the Avengers, Captain Marvel, the Defenders, the Fantastic Four, Power Man, the Punisher and the X-Men as they were in the 1970s, as well asâ€™70s-era characters such as Black Brother, the Deadly Dozen, the Faceless One, Golem, Hellcow, Lady Liberators, Manphibian, Ms. Marvel, Mr. Zodiac, Sons of the Tiger, They Who Wield Power, Xorr the God-Jewel and more!
name: Marvel Legacy: The 1970s Handbook

description:
Number 27 in the B.P.R.D. series.

Hellboy and Abe Sapien take center stage in a flashback story set during Abe's early days at the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense, and Liz Sherman reveals weird tales of the family members that she killed while discovering her firestarter powers. And in Europe, Doctor Kate Corrigan bargains with an ancient evil over the fate of her dead friend, Roger.

Hellboy and Abe Sapien take center stage in a flashback story set during Abe's early days at the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense, and Liz Sherman reveals weird tales of the family members that she killed while discovering her firestarter powers.

In Europe, Doctor Kate Corrigan bargains with an ancient evil over the fate of her dead friend, Roger.

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description:
Number 28 in a series.

As Kate's devilish adventure in a haunted French village concludes, Roger's fate is resolved in an otherworldly confrontation, and each member of the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defenses confronts the truth of their own deaths-which each has had to face alone.

As Abe Sapien is volunteering to go to France to trade is life for Kate's, she finds a way to conclude her adventure in the haunted French village of the Marquis de Fabre.

Though she wasn't able to retrieve the occult book which may have helped Roger's resurrection, his fate is resolved in an otherworldly confrontation, and each member of the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defenses confronts the truth of their own deaths-which each has had to face alone.

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description:
Phil Urich is the new Green Goblin. After Onslaught unleashes a fleet of Sentinels on the city, will Goblin make a personal sacrifice to save innocent lives? An exciting twist in the Green Goblin saga with this Onslaught crossover issue!

Onslaught! Ben Urich and his nephew Phil are walking the strangest of beats as the huge sentinels are decimating New York City! And the goblin faces his greatest enemy - his self-esteem!

Plot

They relay news of the attack to the Daily Bugle, just as a huge Sentinel takes out the newspaper's electricity. Lynn, Meredith, and Phil run up to the roof to get a better look, and are awestruck by the widespread destruction. Lynn and Meredith leave to get a street-level view, and Phil summons his glider. All this time, fear grips the youth, and feelings of uncertainty. Even as he dons the brain-sizzling mask, Phil is pre-occupied with doubts and fears.

When the Goblin attacks the Sentinel, he is greeted only with failure! His pumpkin bombs don't make a dent in the Sentinel's thick armor, and his razor-bat blades only put scratches on the robot's shiny head. Phil tries his maniacal laugh last, and that seems to have an effect, making the Sentinel shake. But, a solid blow landed by the huge android sends Goblin and glider alike sliding into an alleyway. Beaten and desperate, Phil chucks the goblin-mask, and the Sentinel, no longer detecting super-human powers, leaves Phil alone in the alleyway.

Mired in self-pity, Phil recalls his escapades as the Green Goblin, from the fateful night in the Osborn warehouse where he saved his uncle's life by using the Goblin-gear to the most recent adventure against Angel Face. He wonders why people like Spider-Man or Daredevil risk their lives constantly to save lives, and why characters like the Scarlet Spider disappear after a little while. After a little soul-searching, Phil sucks it up, picks his mask back up, and jumps back on his glider!

The Sentinel, recognizing that Phil had re-gained his powers, begins again in his attempts to destroy Phil. However, after a little tricky flying and some slick maneuvering, Phil puts his glider on a suicide run for the Sentinel's head! It slams through the robot's metal cranium, causing a huge explosive. However, a piece of shrapnel from the explosion hits Phil's mask, and totals it!
name: Onslaught Impact 2: Even the Brave Can Fall

description: Contagion' part 5, continued from CATWOMAN #31. Catwoman and Azrael pursue one of the two other survivors of the Clench outbreak but once again find themselves tracked by Tracker! Continued in BATMAN #529.
name: Contagion, Part 4: Requiem for an Immortal

description: Contagion' part 10, continued from CATWOMAN #32. With a cure to the Clench virus seemingly out of reach, Azrael searches the plagueâ€™s origin for an answer. Continued in ROBIN #28.
name: Contagion, 10: Contagion

description: "Contagion" part 2, continued from BATMAN: SHADOW OF THE BAT #48. The safety of the residents of Babylon Towers comes into question when one of their own contracts the deadly virus. Meanwhile, Batman must escape a military enclave if he hopes to save Gotham City! Continued in ROBIN (1993-2009) #27.
name: Contagion, Part 2: The Gray Area

description: "Contagion" part 8, continued from BATMAN: SHADOW OF THE BAT #49. Batman escapes Babylon Towers while Oracle helps Catwoman track down the last remaining survivor of the Clench virus. Continued in CATWOMAN (1993-2001) #32.
name: Contagion, Part 8: Babylon Falls

description:
KnightFall part 4. Exhausted after his encounter with Mr. Zsasz, Batman is unable to come to Robin's aid as he is caught between Bane and Killer Croc in a death duel beneath the steamy streets of Gotham City.

Notes:

  • Cover dated Late May 1993.
  • Part 5 continues in Batman #494.
name: Crocodile Tears

description: With the echoes of last issueâ€™s tragic ending still rattling in his head, Frank Castle finds himself tied to a fencepost with barbed wire, watching what may be his last sunrise!
name: Goin' Out West

description:
CIVIL WAR TIE-IN One member of the FF lies hospitalized, a casualty of the CIVIL WAR that's fragmented the superhuman community! And another member of the team is secretly helping the opposition...even though the consequences will tear the first family of the Marvel Universe apart!

With Johnny Storm in a coma, each member of the Fantastic Four is forced to take a position on the Superhuman Registration Act.

Reed Richards, one of its creators with Tony Stark, is strongly in favor of the registration, his wife Susan Storm stands against it, and Ben Grimm doesn't know where to stand. He's not against it, but he won't do anything to promote the Act.
name: Street Fighting

description:
The Road to CIVIL WAR continues! At a remote scientific outpost, a heavenly artifact becomes the touch-point of a conflict between the Fantastic Four and a reborn Doctor Doom!

Doctor Doom fights the Fantastic Four in Oklahoma, for the powers of Mjolnir, Thor's hammer, where it fell from the sky.
name: The Hammer Falls, part 2

description:
A mysterious object has fallen from the heavens to crash in the Midwest, and Reed Richards has been called in to try to piece together the mystery surrounding it. What is it--and how will it lead into CIVIL WAR and the return of a Marvel mainstay?

The Road to Civil War.

The Fantastic Four are sent to Oklahoma where the Doom Robots are attacking a secret army facility.
name: The Hammer Falls, Part 1

description:
At Hunte Castle final preparations are made for the arrival of the conqueror worm.

Roger the Homunculus teams with Lobster Johnson (who may or may not be alive) to battle a laboratory full of mechanical corpses, while Hellboy is tortured by a big Nazi gorilla.

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description:
The conqueror worm arrives, transforming Nazis into frog people and preparing to bring about the downfall of mankind.

Meanwhile, Hellboy falls through a floor and encounters a cabinet full of human heads, and Roger gets a beating.

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description: The "Angel of Death" reveals the future history of man while Roger and Hellboy hatch a desperate plan to destroy the conqueror worm.

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description: Beyond the inner planets lie the gaseous giants, Jupiter being the largest of all. Orbiting Jupiter is the moon Europa, a hard orb floating in frigid space. Lying beneath Europa's half-mile-thick mantle of shear ice is an ocean, the only one in the solar system thatâ€™s not on Earth. And within those cold waters could rest the key to life on Earth â€” and quite possibly its extinction!

Hellboy leaves behind the familiar strangeness of the B.P.R.D. for even stranger places. He meets a 200-year-old witch doctor and talks to lions, but that's only the beginning of Hellboy's weirdest journey yet. Mike Mignola, award-winning cartoonist and production designer for Atlantis and Blade II, takes his most celebrated creation into the next stage in a very unusual life, beginning in Africa, and going to the bottom of the sea.

Man Of miracles (also known as Mother) allows Spawn to keep his powers while he fights the Disciple in the garden of Eden.

little did he know that the Disciple didn't come alone, and that the one he fought before (XII) was the weakest of the twelve. Lastly, Spawn trusts Cyan and lets himself get killed by the last Disciple, and MoM's most favourite one, Judas Iscariot.

Peter tells MJ and Aunt May of recent events, letting them know that Tony wants him to unmask. After a heartfelt discussion, May and MJ decide Peter should do it. Four days later, Peter decides to flee to Canada. However, May stops him as he departs, gives him a freshly stitched copy of his classic costume to wear at the press conference, and tells him "responsibility means you don't run away". Instead, he flies to Washington where Tony introduces Spider-Man at a press conference. Spidey stands before reporters and tell them he has an announcement to make.
name: The War At Home, Part 1

description: Hellboy battles various and sundry horrors of the deep! A giant fish woman explains that, in order for the world to survive, Hellboy must die; while faeries, elves, and a chicken discuss the fate of the universe.

The thrilling miniseries by Warren Ellis continues! U.N. weapons inspector Nathan Kane investigates the situation at a research satellite orbiting the Jovian moon of Europa. What can be done about the mysterious discovery within the moon's ancient, hidden ocean?Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â

Doors, a multiplanetary corporation manned by modern-day indentured servants, is in orbit around Europa--and they'll do anything to gain alien weapons technology first, no matter how many lives it costs!

As the miniseries continues, U.N. Weapons Inspector Nathan Kane learns more about the ancient race neatly entombed beneath the frozen waves of Europa, and he likes what he sees less and less! What does this brutal race of near-humans have in store for humanity? Â

U.N. weapons inspector Nathan Kane comes face-to-face with the truth of what lies submerged in stasis under the icy dome of Europa's Ocean, and he doesn't like what he sees! But how will these beings feel about us now that they're starting to wake up? Â

The extra-sized, action-packed grand finale! As the mysterious beings who have slumbered for an eon begin to stir, Nathan Kane and his crew must intervene before worlds are laid waste, by either the ancient race or the greedy company trying to hijack them! Â
Standalone issue! The Director has a special mission for Sabretooth!
name: The Underground: Prelude

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: New Storyline: "The Underground" Begins! SOLDIER X joins the cast making his debut as the leader of Weapon X's new adversary, the Underground! But what could the Underground be after? Is it the Director's head on a stake?
name: The Underground, Pt. 1

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: In the city of Tomorrow, Superman has not been seen from in many years. Lois Lane, Jimmy Olsen, Lex Luthor, and The Parasite form a resistance. Metropolis is capsized. The Parasite absorbed some of Superman before his apparent death and as a result still has some of Superman's powers and memories. This is all a result of the heroes falling through some unknown source. Superman is defeated by a villain named Khyber and is thrown from space into the earth, as a result the world shakes as if numerous atomic bombs have gone off, causing the planet to react violently. A deformed Wonder Woman and a new Green Lantern are also part of the resistance in the future.
name: Camelot Falls

description:
Â 
The enigmatic Doctor Phosphorous is back in a story by rising stars Royal McGraw, Marcos Marz and Luciana del Negro! Alex Sartorius was believed to be dead, but rumors of his death have been greatly exaggerated! Now more powerful than ever, Doctor Phosphorous seeks to enact revenge on crime boss Rupert Thorne and only one man can stop his reign of terror: The Batman. Â  Â 
Â 
Dr. Phosphorus escapes from a lab where he has been held since his last appearance and Gotham, and Batman must stop him from blazing a trail of revenge that leads to Rupert Thorne
name: The Return Of Dr. Phosphorus!

description: Overview Daredevil finally gets close to the answers he seeks, but before he finds out the truth, heâ€™ll have to face down two villains both out for his blood -- TOMBSTONE and the all-new, all-different MATADOR!Â
name: The Devil Takes A Ride, Part 3

description:
Story continued from: Batman #494

KnightFall part 6. The Firefly returns and sets Gotham ablaze as Batman continues his fight with the Arkham escapees, and the Joker and the Scarecrow toy with the mayor.

Notes:

  • Cover dated Early June 1993.
  • Link Rambeau is a parody Rush Limbaugh.
  • Part 7 continues in Batman #495.
name: City on Fire

description:
Story continued from: Batman #495

KnightFall part 8. It's Batman vs. Firefly, Robin vs. the Riddler, and the Huntress vs. the Riddler's gang, as Gotham continues to burn.

Notes:

  • Cover dated Late June 1993.
  • Part 9 continues in Batman #496.
name: Burning Questions

description:
Story continued from: Batman #496

Knightfall: Chapter 10. "No Rest for the Wicked!" Story by Chuck Dixon. Art by Graham Nolan and Scott Hanna. Cover by Kelley Jones. The longest night in Batman's life continues as he and the Mayor are swept away by the irresistible force of millions of gallons of water from the Gotham River. Can the Dark Knight find a way out before the underground tunnel fills up and they both drown?

Notes:

  • Cover dated Early July 1993.
  • Part 11 continues in Batman #497.
name: No Rest for the Wicked

description:
Story continued from: Batman #497

Notes:

  • Cover dated Late July 1993.
  • Part 13 continues in Showcase '93 #7.
name: Who Rules the Night

description:
Story continued from: Batman #498

Batman continues to be on the mend, and Jean-Paul is standing in for the great Detective. Jean-Paul allows himself to be drawn into the persona of the Batman and begins to loose his concept of justice. Robin is torn between letting Bruce know, or stay with Jean-Paul to keep him from getting killed. Neither Bruce Wayne or Jean-Paul Valley or gettinw what either expect, and Robin is on the wire.

Notes:

  • Part 17 continues in Batman #499.
name: Lightning Changes

description:
Story continued from: Batman #499.

Notes:

  • Part 19 continues in Batman #500.
name: The Devil You Know

description:
Tara's body arrives at the Durapasya temple. As Swamiji is about to complete the ceremony by sacrificing Tara so the Devi entity can then inhabit her body, Rahul interrupts. His victory is short lived as Iyam and Kratha break their way in and the Durapasya go to arms against all the intruders. Swamiji is killed by Kratha as he again is about to sacrifice Tara, and Agantuk engages her to prevent Tara's death.

In her soma-induced state, Tara is blessed by all the Gods with abilities to aid her in her duties, the last of which is Bodha. Tara/Devi is then infused back into Tara's body and erupts in a great explosion. But, it is not only the Devi entity within the body, but Tara as well. She has become a new kind of Devi, one that is both human and divine. Seeing Rahul, Tara takes him up and refuses to go with the Durapasya as she feels used.
name: Aagaman

description:
Created by: acclaimed filmmaker Shekhar Kapur (Elizabeth, Four Feathers, Bandit Queen).

START OF A NEW STORYLINE! It's been a month since Devi disappeared. In hiding, Tara tries hard to understand whether or not she wants to be a goddess or if she has a choice anyway. Meanwhile, Kratha launches a desperate attempt to break Iyam out of Durapasya captivity to help her finish what she started, and another power that seeks to shape the future of the world emerges.

Agantuk goes to the Cabinet of Shadows, a group battling for the right of man to lead their own lives without affect from gods or demons; he is their agent within the Durapasya. He speaks with them about the Devi situation. She has been unseen for a month and Kratha escaped the night after capture.

He is then introduced to another of the Cabinet's agents. One within the Darinde, the followers of Bala: Amara Gaelle. She speaks of her efforts to find the source, a vessel that contains a millennia of unanswered prayers, which would have immeasurable power if unleashed. A plan is concocted to extract it, but Agantuk receives a call that Iyam has escaped.

Elsewhere, Tara awakes in Rahul's apartment and is told that she has spent the last month in the mogue so she would be safe. She has no memory of this, but Rahul says she caused strange things to happen while there. The two are transported to a woman who was praying for help from Devi as she is being attacked. Unable to call on her powers, the Devi entity takes control and dispatches with the men. After which they are transported back to Rahul's apartemnt and Tara is very distraught about her condition, and gets up to leave.
name: Samsara

description: Devi has her first encounter with Bala's forces, which leads to certain alarming realizations about the extent of her powers, and how she's able to use them. Liberated from Durapasya captivity, Iyam attempts to regain control of the Darinde, to win back his rightful place at the head of Bala's army, and teach Amara Gaelle a lesson or two in the art of skullduggery.
name: Sandeha

description: As the Devi's power grows, Tara's emerging feelings for Rahul open her eyes to issues far more real than divine politics. Yet it is this connection to humanity that weakens her, as she discovers to horrible effect when Kratha tracks down Rahul. Meanwhile, the Durapasya prepare for their attack on the Darinde stronghold, intending to divert Bala's forces and give Amara a chance to steal the source.
name: Aks

description: Events hurtle towards a deadly climax as the Durapasya are forced to attack the Darinde ahead of schedule in order to protect Amara Gaelle, and give her a chance to save the Source. A ferocious battle rages in the heart of Sitapur's largest slum, and thousands of innocent lives are at stake. This is a battle Tara wants no part in, but her hand is forced - Rahul's life is in deadly danger, and she is the only one who can save him.Â
name: Yudh

description:
The Comet reawakens from surgery to find the Electric Light Corporation [ELC] has taken control of HardCore Station and its inhabitants are being held hostage by the Deacon Dark until Comet surrenders. Unfortunately it seems that Comet awakened a tad too late.

Also, just as the Weird chooses sides, it is taken away and his choices are made for him by the ELC.

The Weird Created By Jim Starlin and Bernie Wrightson
name: Ultimatum

description:
Overview

Got a problem that needs fixing? Permanent fixing? Call Mike Fallon, a.k.a. Accident Man. He can arrange a discreet, unsuspicious and entirely unavoidable accident for the victim of your choice -- if you can afford his fee, of course.

In this issue, Fallon meets the beautiful Mirror Morgan, and gets himself embroiled in an intrigue that involves sex, shopping, and several suspicious fatalities. This is the story we just had to call "Sex 'n' Death."

Overview

His name's Fallon, Mike Fallon, a ladies' man, a hit man, but more to the point, an Accident Man, who can fix your problems discreetly and permanently. Now he's out to make an impression on the mafia and passes his test with flying colors, most of it blood red. But there's more to this set-up than meets the eye.

Mike Fallon faces his ultimate challenge as he infiltrates a Mafia cell, where his mission is to eliminate the Godfather. And of course, he's got to make it look like an accident. If he can survive that, then he's got to draw on all his assassin's skills to deal with the beautiful but deadly Stiletto. An Accident Man's work is never done... Duke Mighten's art brings all the style and savoir-faire that has made Wild Thing such a hot book. Fans will want to be sure not to miss the series that displays Mighten's talents unleashed.

Damian's presence at Wayne Manor is proving quite the distraction for Batman. In his efforts to prove himself to his father, Damian has assaulted Alfred, murdered the Spook and nearly killed Robin. But Bruce still has to stop Talia from using an army of Man-Bats against the British government and save the prime minister's kidnapped wife. Since leaving him at home is potentially too dangerous, Batman has no choice but to take his son into the fight with him.
name: Batman & Son, Part 4: Absent Fathers

description: Some police officers got a call about a noise outside.SoÂ they went out there and they saw a man in burning flames sayin kill me, and shoot me. And everybody was trying to find out whereÂ that guy inÂ the image of flames came from. Also Batman flies into the night looking for crimeÂ when suddenly a guy that calls himself Grotesk pops out of nowhere. And then Batman knows that he is the one whoÂ has been killing lots of people lately. So Batman has to end the killing of Grotesk. But the question is will Batman defeat Grotesk?
name: Grotesk Part 1

description:
The second version of Sharon defends herself against an attack on her Raptor by several free-floating humans in space suits. Those attacking her are hoping to capture her to barter her for time aboard ship. The attackers were originally part of a satellite construction team left stranded in space when the Cylons destroyed their ships. The menâ€™s only island is a small barge that can house only twenty people at a time. The men can only earn barge time by bartering something of interest to the bargeâ€™s captain, in this case, Sharon.


On board Galactica, the older generation Cylons continue their attack on Sharon until Adama presses the self-destruct button on a remote, causing the Cylons to explode. Baltar had equipped each of the Cylons with small explosive devices in their helmets. Dr. Cottle is able to revive Sharon.


At the barge, the other Sharon convinces her attackers that they should take over the barge, which they do, with Sharon killing the captain and taking his position.
'Pawn 502' concludes! All spy agencies have special forces. Only Checkmate has Shadowpact - but even magic may not stop a survivor of Luthor's Everyman Project from blowing this op sky-high!
name: Pawn 502, Part 3

description: Spider-Manâ€”a vampire! Dracula, Lord of the Undead! A classroom of bloodsucking 4th graders! And thatâ€™s just the first five pages! Join Howard Chaykin (Avengers, American Flagg) and Marc Guggenheim (Wolverine, CSI: Miami) for a new series featuring the popular character who has launched three movies and a TV series. This self-contained first issue is perfect for both new readers and longtime fans.
name: Splinter Group

description:
A Civil War: Casualties of War special self-contained issue! Itâ€™s claws versus blades as Wolverine takes his VENDETTA to the pages of Blade, written by â€œWolverine: Vendettaâ€ scribe Marc Guggenheim and illustrated by industry legend Howard Chaykin. Plus: A story from Bladeâ€™s mysterious past!

Wolverine has been captured by S.H.I.E.L.D. and is being forced by one of the chiefs to be a part of the Superhuman Registration Act. He ends up breaking out of his shackles and escapes S.H.I.E.L.D..

In Long Beach California Blade is in the middle of a battle with his old enemy Morbius. Wondering why Morbius is not fighting as much against Blade, it turns out Morbius signed with the Superhuman Registration Act and Blade ends up getting captured by S.H.I.E.L.D. agents.

Flashback.

Blade is at a bar with two friends. One of his friends tells Blade that he was attacked by a vampire in a long black rain coat and a cowboy hat.

Now

Now Blade is at the S.H.I.E.L.D. office with it's director Maria Hill. She tells Blade about Wolverine breaking the Registration Act and later escaping and that they want Blade to go after him because Blade might be perfect to take him dead or alive. He he does it, he gets the rights to kill vampires because to S.H.I.E.L.D. killing vampires without government approval is illegal.

Flashback.

Blade finds the vampire but it is nothing like friend described it. Blade attacks the vampire anyway.

Now

Blade sneaks into Wolverine's Brooklyn apartment. Wolverine comes back from a battle with Omega Red and finds Blade in his apartment. Blade tells Wolverine he is after him. Wolverine releases his claws while Blade pulls out his sword. The two charge at each other stabbing each other.

Flashback.

As Blade fights the strong vampire he spots the man in the cowboy hat and the long coat in the shadows.

Now

Wolverine knock Blade of his feet and takes his sword about to stab him with it. All of a sudden Blade fires a gun at wolverine having little effect on him. Wolverine charges but Blade punches him but Wolverine tags him to the ground. Wolverine gets ready to stab him but Blade pulls out a vial of vampire blood that as soon as he injects into Wolverine's body, he turns into a vampire making it easy for Blade to stab him in the heart. All of a sudden Blade pauses and puts the vial away. Blade says "No. I just remembered something. Let me go it is over." Blade says that him and Wolverine are to evenly matched and that S.H.I.E.L.D. won't bother him ever again. This puzzles wolverine.

Back at S.H.I.E.L.D. Blade tells Hill Wolverine is off limits and that he gets to still hunt vampires and back off from Wolverine or else Blade will go after S.H.I.E.L.D. Walking away Blade says that he owes him one.

Flashback.

Blade is nearly killed by the vampire but all of a sudden the man in the hat slams the vampire against the wall, grabs a stake from Blade, and kills the vampire. Blade still shocked from the fight, the man in the hat gives Blade his coat. Blade thanks the man for saving him. The man in the cowboy hat says no problem and that he owes him one. The man in the hat is Wolverine.
name: Vendetta's Echo

description: You asked for it! At long last, Blade comes face to face with his father! Who is this mysterious man? And what dark secret does he hold? Marc Guggenheim and Howard Chaykin have the answers, and they can be found in this special self-contained issue!
name: Two Chambers

description:
Writer Charlie Huston navigates Man-Thing into a creepy tale of the worst kind of dinner invitation... Plus the brilliant Ted McKeever brings his expressionistic storytelling to Simon Garth - the original Marvel Zombie!

The amazing Legion of Monsters series continues, as Moon Knight and Ultimates Annual writer Charlie Huston navigates Man-Thing into a creepy tale of the worst kind of dinner invitationâ€¦ Plus the brilliant Ted McKeever brings his expressionistic storytelling to Simon Garthâ€”the original Marvel Zombie! These are stories that have been begging to be toldâ€”set right in the dark, horrific corners of the Marvel Universe! Read it with the lights on!
name: A Flower in Alien Soil; Morgue Amore

description: Not a hoax! Not an imaginary story! In this issue, Blade... DIES! Marc (WOLVERINE, SQUADRON SUPREME: HYPERION/NIGHTHAWK) Guggenheim and Howard (NEW AVENGERS) Chaykin serve up the unthinkable in this self-contained story that's a perfect jumping-on point for new readers!Â
name: The Mithridates Process

description: Overview Because you demanded it: Hannibal King is back! And the fangs are sure to fly! This Lethal Weapon/Rush Hour-style team-up is brought to you by Marc (Wolverine, Call of Duty 3) Guggenheim and industry legend Howard (New Avengers) Chaykin.Â
name: Unintended Consequences

description: Beginning the new era of the Dark Knight: "Knightsquest!" There's a new Batman in Gotham City and the criminal underworld had better beware, because this Batman plays for keeps.
name: Wild, Wild East

description:
Robin and Batman have their ultimate confrontation, ending with Tim Drake being locked out of the Batcave.

Jean-Paul, as Batman, while heading back to the Batcave, and almost causes a train wreak due to his recklessness.

Meanwhile Tim gets his drivers licence, and can't wait to use it. He leaves Mrs. Mac, and heads to the Batcave. There dressed as Robin, Tim sees that Jean-Paul has made a new target range and is practicing deadly force on targets shaped like Killer Croc, Catwoman and other Batman villains.

Across town, Mr. Doyle hires the Trigger Twins, to help him rob the money train. Meanwhile at Caliber Productions, Mr. Berkowitz, gets a call from the Joker, with the offer for Mr. Berkowitz to produce his biography.

Back at the Batcave, Jean-Paul catches Robin snooping around and the should be partners start fighting. The fight ends when Jean-Paul, pins Robin against the wall.

Story Continues in: Robin #1

Also includes a public service message by Superman titled "The Flood"
name: Runaway

description: A beautiful young woman is dead and Blade is the number one suspect. But how can he prove his innocence when heâ€™s really the one who killed her? Find out in this self-contained issue from Howard Chaykin and Marc Guggenheim.
name: The Accused

description: The second issue in Bladeâ€™s new ongoing series by Howard Chaykin (Bite Club, American Flagg) and Marc Guggenheim (CSI: Miami, Wolverine)! Blade goes up against the monarch of a Balkan nation... but itâ€™s not Dracula (been there, done that). This time, Blade has set his sights on none other than Dr. Doom! Plus, a look into Bladeâ€™s mysterious past!
name: Bargains in Time

description: The White Event. The cosmic phenomenon from which a handful of humans emerged with super human power. The incident that prompted Project Spitfire to initiate its primary mission. Three live super humans on Earth, and the statistical probability that they will meet becomes intolerable. Spitfire knows such a meeting will yield disastrous results. And theyâ€™re willing to do anything to keep that from happeningâ€¦
name: Mystery
